title: Monsoon Update – Storm and heavy rain alert in Tamil Nadu and 4 other states - Times Bull
article_text:
Monsoon Forecast – Intense cold has gripped many parts of the country, making it difficult to venture outdoors. Dense fog has blanketed Haryana, western Uttar Pradesh, and the Delhi-NCR region since morning. Traffic jams are widespread. To prevent major accidents in the fog, vehicles have to use their indicators even during the day.

Continuous snowfall is occurring in the mountains of Himachal Pradesh. Snowfall is also being reported in the hilly areas of Uttarakhand and Jammu and Kashmir. The number of tourists heading to the mountains is increasing, with people flocking there for sightseeing. Rainfall in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry has led to a drop in temperature. The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted rain in various parts of the country.

Read More: Aadhaar Update After Marriage: How to Change Father’s Name to Husband’s Name Online in 2025?

Impact of Rain in Kashmir

According to the Meteorological Department, snowfall is occurring in the hilly areas of Kashmir. Travellers are advised to check conditions before traveling to mountainous regions. The sun was not visible in the Kashmir Valley yesterday. The intense cold continues to increase. However, a slight improvement in the minimum night temperature has been recorded. In many areas, the mercury has risen above freezing point, hovering around zero degrees Celsius.

Increasing Cold in Rajasthan

According to the IMD, the impact of the cold wave is increasing in Rajasthan. Minimum and maximum temperatures are continuously falling. The minimum temperature in Nagaur is expected to be around 3.6 degrees Celsius, 3.7 degrees in Fatehpur (Sikar), and 5.3 degrees in Sikar.

Read More: Looking for 10%+ Returns in a Year? Here Are 5 Smart Short-Term Investment Options

The weather is expected to remain clear in most parts of the state for the next two or three days. Cloudy conditions are also expected in some areas of the state.

Rain Expected in These States

According to the IMD, rainfall is expected in several parts of South India. Thunderstorms and rain are expected in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry in the next 24 hours. Lightning strikes are also expected in many areas. Heavy rainfall with thunder and lightning is predicted in Puducherry. Rain and thunderstorms are also expected in some parts of Kerala, Andhra Pradesh, and Karnataka.
